value: content=The main beach stretches along the old town. This is the main swimming beach and even if you don't want to get wet or sun yourself, it's worth a walk to take in the scenery. On the active side, there's beach volleyball and an activities area for children. Like all things in this region of France, it will get very busy during the summer holidays.

The inside architecture is Basque-influenced with the balconies along the walls and ship hanging from the ceiling. The Church also hosts periodic events in the evenings.

The old town is very attractive with a mix of buildings and splashes of white, red and green (the Basque colours). You can gaze at beach or the old fishing village or learn a little of the town's history through the interpretive plaques (in French) that have been set up.
